item.title: Clean Chroot Builds on Arch Linux
item.description: A clean chroot build is preferred when there are package dependencies during aur package installation. This article should allow us to perform one such clean chroot build using the guided aur package called clean chroot manager(ccm). Install CCM yay -S clean-chroot-manager Setup base config for chroot Run the sudo ccm64 c command to generate a default clean-chroot-manager.conf Create a chroot path running mkdir ~/chroot
